|elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = 312 |elevation_ft = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |blank_name = |blank_info = |blank1_name = |blank1_info = |website = |footnotes = }} Kara is a city in northern Togo. It is the capital of Kara Region. It is 413 km north of the capital Lomé. According to the 2010 census, 94,878 people lived there. The Kara River flows through the city. The city was developed in the 1970s, when the village was first called Lama-Kara. The University of Kara is at the southern edge of the city. The President of Togo Gnassingbé Eyadéma was born in the nearby village of Pya. == Other websites == * Category:Cities in Togo
